data.title: Bracket highlighting Shifts Codelens Slightly
IntelliSense problems if `Flow` plugin is used
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.11.2
- OS Version: Linux Ubuntu 16.04

Hello, I opened issue here https://github.com/flowtype/flow-for-vscode/issues/97 and they said it's VS Code problem, maybe anyone can take attention on that? This plugin is very good, because it improves IntelliSense and we don't need to use `.ts` files to have improved IntelliSense, but the problem is, it somehow duplicates suggestions and some of them arranges to the end or at the middle which is really bad, but still is it better to have this with improved IntelliSense. I know `Flow` and `TypeScript` not the best friends since VS Code using `TypeScript` it makes zero sense to you for trying to fix it, but it will be very cool from your side.

P.S. If someone are lazy to check issue on `Flow` plugin which is above I can post here all the content from the issue I opened.

Thank you.

data.title: Fix #24971. PowerShell Extension .bat & .exe Syntax Highlighting Error
data.body:
By changing the regular expression as per this PR, .bat and .exe files will be properly highlighted.

### Code to reproduce
```
something.bat 
ipconfig.exe
Import-Module AzureRM.Backup
Import-Module AzureRm.Batch 
Import-Module AzureRm.Exefake
Import-Module AzureRM.Cdn
21jumpstreet.bat 
```

### Results before applying this change
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/13203965/25149995/b2fa1cf0-243d-11e7-87d7-123f33ad94f9.png)

### Results after applying this change
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/13203965/25150211/6524e446-243e-11e7-980a-2b9eb294c9cd.png)

data.title: Error on parameter naming (MVC, C#)
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.11.2 (6eaebe3b9c70406d67c97779468c324a7a95db0e, 2017-04-13T08:03:11.395Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.14393
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|gitignore|codezombiech|0.5.0|
|vscode-express|Compulim|0.0.5|
|git-project-manager|felipecaputo|1.2.1|
|vscode-nuget-package-manager|jmrog|1.1.2|
|mssql|ms-mssql|0.3.0|
|csharp|ms-vscode|1.8.1|
|vscode-icons|robertohuertasm|7.5.1|
|gitblame|waderyan|1.3.0|;


---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create a new c# controller (MVC)
2. insert code: 
`public class ParticleController : Controller 
    {
        [HttpPost]
        public ParticleEvent Index(ParticleEvent event)
        {
            return event;
        }
    }`

Error: 
gives an error on the parameter name "event" (event property must have aboth add and remove accessors)

data.title: PowerShell Syntax Highlighting Error: .bat and .exe files
data.body:
There's syntax highlighting as part of the PowerShell extension to indicate commands. This makes things like `something.bat` and `ipconfig.exe` the same color as PowerShell cmdlets like `import-module`. The highlighting for .bat and .exe files doesn't properly detect when .bat or .exe is part of a longer word. It also does not properly highlight .bat and .exe files whose names start with numbers.

## Code to reproduce
```
something.bat 
ipconfig.exe
Import-Module AzureRM.Backup
Import-Module AzureRm.Batch 
Import-Module AzureRm.Exefake
Import-Module AzureRM.Cdn
21jumpstreet.bat 
```

## Result of code
Using Monokai Dimmed theme for emphasis.
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/13203965/25149995/b2fa1cf0-243d-11e7-87d7-123f33ad94f9.png)

Lines 4, 5 and 7 have incorrect syntax highlighting.

## Diagnostic info
```
code --list-extensions --show-versions
ms-vscode.PowerShell@0.12.2
ms-vsts.team@1.115.0
msazurermtools.azurerm-vscode-tools@0.3.4
yanz.markdown-authoring@0.1.5

code -v
1.11.2
6eaebe3b9c70406d67c97779468c324a7a95db0e

$PSVersionTable

Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      5.1.14393.1066
PSEdition                      Desktop
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0...}
BuildVersion                   10.0.14393.1066
CLRVersion                     4.0.30319.42000
WSManStackVersion              3.0
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
```

## Possible Fix
 It appears that the regular expression that detects these patterns is flawed: [https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/extensions/powershell/syntaxes/PowershellSyntax.tmLanguage#L243](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/extensions/powershell/syntaxes/PowershellSyntax.tmLanguage#L243 ) 

By replacing the above linked line with a better regular expression, this issue could be resolved.

### More appropriate regular expression
`<string>(\b(([A-Za-z0-9\-_\.]+).(?i:exe|com|cmd|bat))\b)</string>`

### Results after applying fix
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/13203965/25150211/6524e446-243e-11e7-980a-2b9eb294c9cd.png)

data.title: Ran debug on a script and some other command executed instead
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version:  1.10.2
- OS Version: Microsoft Windows Server 2012 R2 Standard

Steps to Reproduce:

1.  Right clicked a PowerShell script in Windows Explorer
2.  Chose Open With Code.  No other open scripts in the editor.  I edited a file path in the script and did not click anywhere else.
3.  Clicked the "Start Debugging" green arrow
4.  The script was not executed.  It kicked off a command that I now see in the Terminal window.  It looked like something I had typed in a regular PowerShell console weeks ago.  No idea how that was stored or cached or why the script did not run.  This was seriously bad as it kicked off an unwanted ETL process.

data.title: Ripgrep search missing results in Windows network drives using dedupe
data.body:
When I try and search globally using Ctrl-Alt-F it is only showing me matches in the files that are opened and have been viewed in the editor. By viewed, I mean that after shutting down VSC and restarting it, search will only show me results in the files that have been the active tab in that session so far (so initially results for only 1 file). I can work around this by setting `"search.useRipgrep": false`, but this doesn't seem like the expected behavior since it used to search all files by default.

- VSCode Version: Code 1.11.2 (6eaebe3b9c70406d67c97779468c324a7a95db0e, 2017-04-13T08:03:11.395Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 6.1.7601
- Extensions:

```json

    "typescript.check.tscVersion": false,
    "window.zoomLevel": 0,
    "editor.renderWhitespace": "none",
    "workbench.colorTheme": "Visual Studio Dark",
    "workbench.iconTheme": "vs-seti",
}
```

data.title: Using WSL - Running a task using existing environment variables and without the "Press any key to close the terminal" requirement

milestone.title: On Deck
milestone.description:
The Issues assigned to the **On Deck** milestone under consideration for the upcoming milestones.
Our goal is to always have less than 100 Issues on deck.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.11.2
- OS Version: Windows 10  (Version 1703), with WSL enabled.

I use Bash On Ubuntu On Windows, and I try to make it my default terminal in VSCode. In my `User Settings` :

```
"terminal.integrated.shell.windows": "C:\\Windows\\sysnative\\bash.exe"
```

It is a Node application written in TypeScript. I use Gulp to run tasks and it works well if I use the terminal directly. But now I try to make `CTRL-SHIFT-B` run the build command task, which has to call "`node_modules/.bin/gulp compile`" to run the transpilation from TypeScript to Javascript.

Thanks to [this thread](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/6579), I'm able to at least start the compilation with this `tasks.json` file :

```
{
    "version": "2.0.0",
    "command": "node_modules/.bin/gulp",
    "isShellCommand": true,
    "suppressTaskName": true,
    "tasks": [
        {
            "taskName": "tsc",
            "args": [
                "compile"
            ],
            "isBuildCommand": true,
            "problemMatcher": "$tsc"
        }
    ]
}
```

The compilation starts but _fails_ because it involves the `oracledb` library which needs some environment variables to be set :
```
export LD_LIBRARY_PATH=/usr/local/oracle/instantclient:$LD_LIBRARY_PATH
export OCI_LIB_DIR=/usr/local/oracle/instantclient
export OCI_INC_DIR=/usr/local/oracle/instantclient/sdk/include
```
When I run `env` directly in the terminal, I see those variables since they are exported in my `~/.bashrc` file, and this is why the direct compilation works. But when the compilation is ran from the task, those variable are not set, for some reason!

1) How can I make the task to automatically source my `~\.bashrc` file? Or should I define the exports in another file for them to work?

2) At the end of the task, a "_Press any key to close the terminal_" message is displayed. Is there a way to output the task to the "output" console instead? Or at least is it possible to remove the requirement to press a key at the end? I'd prefere to not have to do that each time I build using `CTRL-SHIFT-B`.

data.title: PowerShell extension fails to start powershell
data.body:
Updated VSCode on my Mac and after that, VSCode fails to load PowerShell in the terminal window
Re-installed PowerShell and re-installed PowerShell extension.
No installs of any other extension, first startup of VSCode of the day, VSCode & PowerShell combo was working yesterday, got a message that I needed to restart VSCode because there was a new version/update of VSCode and it needed to finalize this update.

Have not yet re-installed VSCode as I don't want to lose settings I have set up until now.

- VSCode Version: 1.11.2
- OS Version: macOS Sierra 10.12.4

$PSVersionTable                                                                            
Name                           Value                                                                                   
----                           -----                                                                                   
PSVersion                      6.0.0-alpha                                                                             
PSEdition                      Core                                                                                    
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0...}                                                                 
BuildVersion                   3.0.0.0                                                                                 
GitCommitId                    v6.0.0-alpha.17                                                                         
CLRVersion                                                                                                             
WSManStackVersion              3.0                                                                                     
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3                                                                                     
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1

Error Messages:
- Language server startup failed.
- The terminal process terminated with exit code: 1
- Log dump from "Output" window:
[19:32:28] Language server starting...
powershell.exe started --
powershell.exe started --
powershell.exe started --
powershell.exe started --
powershell.exe terminated or terminal UI was closed
[19:33:29] Language server startup failed.
Could not start language service: 
Could not start language service: 

The Terminal window does show some red text in the Terminal window but it disappears too quickly for me to be able to read.
PS: the Terminal window is able to start powershell if I type manually "powershell"

data.title: "Change All Occurrences" regression: Match Whole Word / Match Case state is broken
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.11.2
- OS Version: Ubuntu

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Use "Change All Occurrences" on any word / symbol
2. Try to set "Match Whole World" and/or "Match Case". Issues:
  a. "Match Whole World",  "Match Case" buttons toggle each other (appear to be exclusive, no way to set both as in previous version of vs code)
  b. Subsequent "Change All Occurrences" do not use the last state - it resets to both "Match Whole World",  "Match Case" unchecked.

data.title: How to make a Old Mobiles Message Composer in C++
data.body:
Write a program in DEV C++ that compose message in the same fashion as in old mobiles message composer. The program must receive integer input. When use enter 2 the program outputs letter ‘A’and if 2 is pressed twice, the letter ‘A’will disappear from screen and character ‘B’will appear and if 2 is pressed thrice the letter ‘B’will disappear and Letter C will appear. To enter ‘AA’you have to enter number ‘2’twice with delay. Delay must be as smaller as it is usually in the mobile

NOTE: Do not use the "Character array and String"


Please me for this Very soo......

data.title: Column breakpoints - BreakpointEvent
data.body:
If VS Code sets a breakpoint that isn't a column BP, it ignores the column in the response from the debug adapter. If the adapter later sends a BreakpointEvent for that BP, it doesn't ignore the column. Should VS Code ignore the column in that case too, or should the debug adapter keep track of whether a BP is a column BP or not, and decide whether to send the column?

I'm ok with either option, but it seems like the two cases could be consistent.

data.title: Code Insider complains "Could not install typings files for JS/TS language features. Please ensure that NPM is installed"
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: Insider (daily latest, 1.12.0)
- OS Version: Mac OS X 10.12.4

Steps to Reproduce:

1. I've nvm, node, and npm installed the current version in the system.
2. Open Code Insider
2. Open any existing JavaScript (ES) node project, warning appears:
"Could not install typings files for JS/TS language features. Please ensure that NPM is installed"

data.title: Search and Ctrl + P take forever to find results
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.11.2
- OS Version: Windows 10 Pro

Making a new issue per: @bpasero https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/13665#issuecomment-294681979

I work from a network drive to a linux server in my house. The server is Ubuntu 16.04 and I use Samba for the file sharing. Until recently (a 3-4 weeks ago?) VS Code worked fantastically. Since then search and `Ctrl + P` took forever to return results.

Following Benjamin's advice I've disabled RIPgrep from preferences and everything seems to be working again (knocks on wood), I'll report back if that's not the case.

Thanks so much, love VS Code <3

Original comment: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/13665#issuecomment-292278754

data.title: When dragging folder to new editor window (to use explorer), don't make it mandatory to save any unsaved files elsewhere
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.11.1 (d9484d12b38879b7f4cdd1150efeb2fd2c1fbf39, 2017-04-06T14:00:34.044Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.5.0
- Extensions: none
---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. open a new window, add some text, don't save it
2. open another new separate window, drag a folder from Finder to this window
3. observe that asked to save file. why?! just leave it there unsaved and allow me to get on and use the other new window with explorer thankyouverymuch!

data.title: Can't search in debug console (OS X insider build)
data.body: How can I enable search in debug console?

data.title: Some parts miss ClearType rendering (subpixel anti-aliasing)

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
For some reason parts of our UI fall back to grayscale-antialias, specifically:
* quick open
* components inside the panel
* text inside webviews

Screenshots as reference:

![debug-console](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/900690/25134961/41c47936-2451-11e7-83b4-f2cdaf3b0550.png)
![problems](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/900690/25134962/41ca2f48-2451-11e7-94c4-ca75ff130fce.png)
![quickopen](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/900690/25134958/41c1a418-2451-11e7-8e19-1f9f80ccdb5a.png)
![terminal](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/900690/25134960/41c37522-2451-11e7-8850-9ac1ab5d4126.png)
![panel](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/900690/25134964/420ee1b0-2451-11e7-9d92-87db7743f7e4.png)
![webview](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/900690/25134959/41c2872a-2451-11e7-94c1-83f0fc1b795e.png)

Related: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/17827
Related: https://www.html5rocks.com/en/tutorials/internals/antialiasing-101/

data.title: Autocomplete for JS files but not TS files? (TypeScript 2.2 and 2.3)
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version:

  VS Code Insiders
  Version 1.12.0-insider (1.12.0-insider)

- OS Version:

  macOS Sierra
  10.12.4 (16E195)

Steps to Reproduce:

```
mkdir test-dir
cd test-dir
npm i -D typescript
node_modules/.bin/tsc --init
touch index.ts
touch index.js
npm i snoowrap # Any library without types
code-insiders .
```

Now, Look at this, in `index.js`:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/171637/25134085/00eafd40-2492-11e7-8c14-113dd9312ede.png)


However, in `index.ts`:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/171637/25134136/249f58e4-2492-11e7-8194-e81f517b0247.png)

I tried a few libraries, like `reddit-oauth`, and `chrome-remote-interface` (sorry for the obscure choices, it wasn't the intention of testing this). 

Basically any library without typings. Libraries with typings, as well as my own files, all work very well. For example, all my Angular 2 applications) work just fine.

The particular pictures show no suggestions because I also disabled snippets `"editor.snippetSuggestions": "none"`, but I confirmed with and without this setting.

I tried this with both TypeScript 2.2 and 2.3. I tried messing with several options in `tsconfig.json`, and it didn't seem to make a difference. 
Things like `"allowJs": true,` or enabling `typeAcquisition` (not sure what it is). I also had `"moduleResolution": "node",` all the time.

data.title: Code unable to determine file encoding
data.body: - VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.12.0-insider (7efc373d6874511f730bdf7a30b4728ce84b22a8, 2017-04-18T06:12:01.182Z) - OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.15063 - Extensions: |Extension|Author|Version| |---|---|---| |project-manager|alefragnani|0.14.0| |gitignore|codezombiech|0.5.0| |vscode-yaml-validation|djabraham|0.0.1| |git-extension-pack|donjayamanne|0.1.2| |githistory|donjayamanne|0.2.0| |python|donjayamanne|0.6.2| |vscode-PSStackoverflow|DougFinke|0.0.2| |gitlens|eamodio|3.4.5| |PowerShell|ms-vscode|0.12.2| |vscode-run-git-difftool|narekmal|0.0.4| |git-pull-upstream|samschneller|0.0.7| |python|tht13|0.2.3| |ansible-autocomplete|timonwong|0.0.2| |python-extended-snippets|tushortz|0.0.1| |jinja|wholroyd|0.0.7| |vscode-open-in-github|ziyasal|1.2.3|; --- Steps to Reproduce: JSON file opened using Source Control: GIT While in the GIT code unable to determine encoding format. Open the same file in the code explorer browser, it will determine encoding to be UTFS-16 LE [2racksample-ip.zip](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/files/929740/2racksample-ip.zip)

data.title: Inserting file path on the terminal, when dragging a file to it
data.body:
This feature was suggested in https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/11907

I've tested the following scenarios, on a MacOS device:

* Dragging a file from the OS filesystem to the terminal
* Dragging a file from the tree explorer to the terminal
* Dragging a tab from the tab panel to the terminal

Let me know if any change is needed

data.title: added config option git.cloneDirectory, defaulting to os.homedir()
data.body:
Fixes #17671.

Added a new option called git.cloneDirectory, to be used as the base path for the `git.clone` command. When it is not set by the user, it will use the current default - `os.homedir()`.

data.title: VSCode auto completion not working as before
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.11.2
- OS Version: macos

Steps to Reproduce:

1. My REST Client extension previously will have auto completion for header value, but in latest version when I checked this, it doesn't work as expected, that means no auto completion at all
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2796177/25130477/da01f084-2474-11e7-8697-1e525265a762.png)

2. However, when I remove the space after the colon, I can get the auto completion.
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2796177/25130596/4f9a8f86-2475-11e7-8936-97c268affb0f.png)

data.title: Window - manager for opening projects
data.body:
Request: please make a convenient window manager to open the project.

More precisely: it should merge the folders with the projects in the selected repositories, with the ability to sort by the date of opening and the date of creation / modification of the folder.

Sometimes I forgot some small thing that was beautifully done by 15 projects back, but you do not remember in which project (under what name, mb it is generally a feature test was what) and where it (the project) can be.

data.title: Ctrl - Backspace is deleting the previous '({['
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->
In the new version of vscode, Ctrl - Backspace is deleting the previous brackets. This break with previous behavoir, slowing me down.
- VSCode Version: 1.11.2
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

given the cursor on the beginning of line 2.
![1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3108592/25129247/7b375ec2-243d-11e7-96e3-a38e8defa284.PNG)

If I type `Ctrl + Backspace`, the following happens

![2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3108592/25129410/3887f63a-243e-11e7-8b29-9e0fa6b42bdf.PNG)

I expected 
![3](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3108592/25129447/678e0fb4-243e-11e7-9db7-be216788ec07.PNG)

data.title: Resolve imports nested addresses (after slashes)
data.body:
Say I want to import from `xstream` module:

This works:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/736697/25127184/727eaa54-244e-11e7-8eff-76b80211c033.png)

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/736697/25127205/8440bc5a-244e-11e7-8fd4-4b1153809c82.png)

But if I want to import from nested module `xstream/extra/flattenConcurrently` vscode doesn't help
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/736697/25127227/9195acda-244e-11e7-9db7-1a564361e523.png)

This could be would be valuable.
